news_header: Ukrainian journalist Viktoria Roshchyna died in Russian custody after reporting on the war in Ukraine, raising concerns about the treatment of journalists.
news_text: Viktoria Roshchyna, a 27-year-old Ukrainian journalist, died after 15 months in Russian captivity, reportedly while being transferred for a prisoner exchange. She had been arrested in March 2022 and had previously been released in a swap. Roshchyna disappeared in August 2023 and was confirmed detained by Russia in May 2024. Her death has sparked outrage and sympathy among colleagues and officials, with calls for an investigation into the circumstances surrounding her death. The European Union condemned the incident and highlighted ongoing issues of violence and intimidation against journalists in conflict zones.
